Constructor Detail

Circuit

public Circuit(Circuit origCircuit)
Constructs a copy of a given circuit by adding in the same set of components. Information regarding branches, currents, voltages, etc. will NOT be copied. These can be regenerated by using findNodes(), labelBranches() and solve().

Parameters:
origCircuit - The Circuit object that you wish to copy

Circuit

public Circuit(int row,
               int col)
Constructs a new Circuit object with a grid of terminals with particular dimensions

Parameters:
row - The number of rows of terminals in the circuit
col - The number of columns of terminals in the circuit

findNodesAndLoops

public int findNodesAndLoops(java.util.List<Terminal> nodes,
                             java.util.List<java.util.List<Component>> origLoops)
This method uses helper methods to: (1) populate the ArrayList of nodes (junctions) for a circuit; (2) assign a current/branch number to each independent branch of the circuit; (3) assign a current direction to each component within each branch; (4) populate a List of loops, wherein each loop is a List of the components in that loop;

Parameters:
nodes - An empty ArrayList that will be populated with the terminals that are junctions in the circuit.
loops - An empty ArrayList of Lists of components that will be populated with components from circuit loops.
Returns:
The number of branches in the circuit, excluding any dead-end branches.
